title.narrative: Preservation of the Ruins of the Late 18th-Century Church of the Nativity in Krohkino

description.narrative: Built in 1788, the Church of the Nativity is all that remains of the former village of Krokhino, which was flooded in 1964 to create the Sheksna Reservoir. Following the flooding and resettlement of the townspeople, the church became a lighthouse to guide boats through the flood zone. This project supports a suite of interventions to strengthen the banks and foundation of the former church.

title.narrative: Legislative Fellows Program

description.narrative: Legislative Fellows Program: Alumni of the Future Leaders Exchange (FLEX) program will spend four to six weeks in U.S. state legislatures to expand their experience with the legislative process. This funding will support a follow-on program which allows participants to take part in simulated legislative activities. Participants will also give presentations about legislation and civic participation to their peers and to local and regional leaders in Russia.

transaction.usg:treasury-account: Department of State, Migration and Refugee Assistance

title.narrative: Legislative Fellows Program

description.narrative: Legislative Fellows Program: The Legislative Fellows Program is an internship program for alumni of the Future Leaders Exchange (FLEX) program. Participants spend four to six weeks in U.S. state legislatures, where they experience the day-to-day work of U.S. legislative bodies and expand their knowledge of the legislative process. The funding requested will support a follow-on program, which includes an online congress that allows participants to take part in simulated legislative activities. Participants will also give presentations about legislation and civic participation to their peers and to local and regional leaders.

person-name.narrative: Jenee Sharon; Wes Aviles; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Conservation of Early 16th-Century Frescoes by the School of Raphael at the Hermitage Museum in St. Petersburg

description.narrative: Acquired in 1861 during the reign of the Russian emperor Alexander II, the three early 16th-century frescoes by the School of Raphael at the Hermitage Museum are among eight dedicated to the theme of love that once decorated the loggia of a small villa in Rome. This project involves the documentation and conservation of the murals to mark the 500th anniversary of the death of the Italian painter, Raffaello Sanzio da Urbino, known as Raphael.
